meanings.definition: Combine or blend into a whole.
meanings.sent1: She intergraded the colors to create a beautiful painting.
meanings.sent2: The chef intergraded the spices to enhance the flavor of the dish.
meanings.sent3: The students intergraded their ideas to come up with a unique project.
meanings.sent4: Her passion for music and dance intergraded seamlessly in her performance.
meanings.sent5: The diverse ingredients intergraded perfectly to form a delicious soup.

meanings.sent1: He intergraded the different genres of music to create a unique playlist.
meanings.sent2: The rivers intergraded at the delta, forming a new ecosystem.
meanings.sent3: The colors intergraded in a surprising way, creating a mesmerizing pattern.
meanings.sent4: The diverse cultures intergraded over time, enriching the community.
meanings.sent5: The flavors intergraded harmoniously, creating a delightful taste.

meanings.definition: Unite or incorporate into a larger whole.
meanings.sent1: The architect intergraded modern and traditional elements in the design.
meanings.sent2: The company intergraded new technologies into their existing systems.
meanings.sent3: The puzzle pieces intergraded perfectly, revealing the complete picture.
meanings.sent4: His experiences intergraded to shape his unique perspective on life.
meanings.sent5: The different voices intergraded to form a powerful choir performance.
